intro: Limnorchis huronensis, commonly known as the Huronensis waterflea, is a small crustacean belonging to the order Cladocera. It is primarily found in freshwater environments, particularly in the Great Lakes region of North America. This species plays a vital role in aquatic ecosystems by serving as a primary food source for various fish and invertebrates. Limnorchis huronensis is typically transparent or pale in color, with a distinct, segmented body structure. Its life cycle includes a planktonic larval stage, which contributes to its ecological significance in maintaining water quality and biodiversity.
